p: For C. coli strains, the MIC value for C. cassia was 200 µg/mL, while the MIC value for the remaining extracts was 400 µg/mL. The MIC values for EOs and pure phytochemicals were the same for both C. coli strains. However, for antibiotics, CC–CI was resistant to CIP, NAL, and TET, while CC–RS was sensitive to all used antimicrobials.
